result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd) and Operating w/ PAC (3rd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (3rd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Bruce P Kunze was found guilty of OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Any vehicles T&R in defendant's name, as is defendant himself.  IID to be installed within 14 days.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant must be in full compliance with drivers safety plan.  

Absolute sobriety.  

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

timeConds.notes: 25 days to be SERVED, 100 days I&S as deft is eligible for SSTOP.  Jail time with huber for work/treatment if deft qualifies under jail classification system.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: of Plea Hearing held on September 1, 2015 before Honorable Gregory E. Grau

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt:
Clerk Cheree
Case called: 10:42am
State appears by ADA S.Brubacher.  Def appears in person/pro se.
 VR not applicable.

State moves to:
Ct. 2 (PAC 3rd)>>DISMISS
Ct. 3 (OAR)>>D&RI
Ct. 4 (IID/Fail to Install)>>D&RI
COURT GRANTS ABOVE

PLEA:
Ct. 1 (OWI 3rd)>>NO CONTEST

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, def is competent to represent self; a factual basis & def guilty.

COURT ORDERS: Sentence W/held; 2 years probation
CONDITIONS: $1694 inclusive; 125 days MCJ Total: 25 days to be served with 100 days I&S as Defendant is eligible for SSTOP Program, w/huber for work/treatment if defendant qualifies under jail classification system, to begin within 45 days at discretion of PO, 27 month DL Rev w/credit;   Any vehicles titled and registered in the defendant's name are ordered to have IID installed and IID is ordered on defendant him/herself, both for a period of 27 months; IID to be installed within 14 days; $50 IID surcharge to be paid; Defendant must be in full compliance with driver's safety plan, IID order and DL rev order as conditions of probation; Absolute sobriety; AODA (deemed already completed).

Adj: 10:53am

Clerk Cheree
Case called: 8:58am
State appears by ADA S.Brubacher. Defendant appears in person/pro se.
(Set for Tent Plea Date)

Parties note agreement has been reached in this matter - Defendant is waiting for AODA to be completed and then anticipates participation in SSTOP program
COURT questions length of time between assessment/program acceptance - State notes 

COURT directs parties to set another FPT during the week of 8/24
COURT reminds defendant he MUST appear for the Attic meeting on August 18th; Defendant states agreement.
Bond continues.

Adj: 9:02am

Shall not consume alcohol.  No bars, taverns, liquor stores or beer tents.  Shall not drive a motor vehicle without valid driver's license.  Contact Attic Correctional Services at 715-848-3202 within five (5) business days.
